headline: Yearning Against the Self
description: A psalm of embodied contradiction written in the Ash Moon Ascending ‚Äî The Door of Trust. Aleksandr confronts desire that crosses boundaries of form: yearning for the flesh of man in the body of woman, for safety in the face of fear, for holiness within lust. This is not an apology but an exposure ‚Äî the sacred tension between the erotic and the divine, where sin becomes the shadow of devotion. In this confession, gender and faith twist around the same ache: to be held, to be known, to be free.

associatedMedia.description: A dim room where a man kneels before an unseen figure, shadow and candlelight blurring his reflection. The air trembles with confession: between altar and flesh, he prays not to be unmade by desire.

motifMap.meaning: The erotic as sacred flame ‚Äî that which burns not to destroy, but to purify longing through truth.
Union of opposites ‚Äî the body as vessel of paradox, where gender and grace entwine.
Confession as peace ‚Äî the courage to speak desire without shame, as a prayer for safety.
Ash Moon ‚Äî faith‚Äôs renewal through exposure, the soul ascending by walking through its own shadow.
